content: Can not download torrents to phone storage. Disappointed and refund not acceptable.
Adding new torrents does not work. Very Strange.

A great app, very handy to manage qbittorrent. I have only one issue and that's I can not add a torrent from local storage as it's locked on a folder called "device" and can not browse as the back arrow just takes me back to the app and not to the root of my phone.
Categories. It's so disappointing this still doesn't have the ability to set the categories. It's a feature that I used so often. Frustrating that it was removed and still hasn't been added back.

Any way you could add the ability to modify active, downloading, and seeding count? Otherwise no difference from free. But considering how useful and reliable it is. The "upgrade" was worth it. Now how about a dark theme for the settings?
Absolutely great. Makes managing torrents easy
Works great, even better than expected, but it would be better if i could have the ability to rename the server instead of server 1 2 etc..

Since upgraded to v4.8.4 it no longer connect to qbittorrent 4.0.3. Edit, the author has advised that the new version is only compatible with qbittorrent 4.1.5 and higher. I had to upgrade my Ubuntu distro from 18.04 to 19.04 which has qbittorrent-nox 4.1.5 and everything is working well now. 5 stars. EDIT: qbittorrent-controller used to have the ability to assign tag to downloads. This feature is very important to me as it allows me to automatically move downloaded files into the right folder
replyContent: Hi, new versions supports 4.2.x (4.1.5 and higher are supported as well). It only works with newer qBittorrent versions. EDIT: I'm glad it works for you again!

content: Transdroid. This app is copied from free and open source app called Transdroid, Google and download it instead. It was more features and supports waaay more servers and not just 1 client. Wasted my money but what can you do üòÖ EDIT: Reply to the reply, No one who knows about Transdroid would pay for something which is copied from it and has less features.
replyContent: This is a open source project as well. You can check it at https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller. This app is meant for qBittorrent only, and includes specific features that other apps don't support . You have the free version for testing before buying it and the grace period after for any refund. EDIT You have free will. Regards!

content: Just bought this app. I would have given this five stars, but there is no option to force resume. Please add if possible. Thanks..... Update: five stars
replyContent: Hi, Imthian that will be addressed in a future release. EDIT: Added in release 4.8.8. Regards! EDIT: Thanks for your rating and comments!

content: The app is good and I like it. Theme switching based on the system will be very good.
replyContent: Hi Dimitar, thanks for your 5-stars review. I really appreciate it! That will be added in a future release. Best Regards!

content: Love the app but I rebuilt my PC, had problems logging in and now says I'm banned due to too many logins! Please help. Edit: Developer responded immediately with solution. Thanks!
replyContent: Just restar your qBittorrent server to remove the ban. And be sure to set the right user and password in qBController to avoid new bans. Regards!

content: Just stoped working. Cant get it to connect at. I am using No-IP, same as i was using before
replyContent: Hi Bruno, check if your IP address device is banned. I so, restar your qBittorrent server and double check your account settings. Regards!

content: Easy to use and connect. No issues so far
replyContent: Hi Gareth, thanks for your comments and your review. really appreciate them!

content: The free version rocks, but this one can not establish connection to my latest qB. I see the log about dropping 4.1.x support, but I had no problems with the free one and I'm running 8.0 android so I'm a bit stuck :) nonetheless this app is superior to all alternatives.. and believe me. I've tested almost all of them. Will give the fifth star after fixing 4.1.x :) Edit: Works like a charm!
replyContent: Hi, new qBController versions are for qBitorrent 4.1.x and 4.2.x. If you are using lower versions use qBController 4.5.8 (free) or 4.6.4 (pro). Both available at https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/releases/tag/v4.5.8. Another option is to upgrade your qBittorrent version to 4.2.x. EDIT: You can use a Docker image for newer versions.

content: Great app and the bug of having to enter password each time it starts or giving authentication error is fixed with latest update (May 2020)
replyContent: Hi Pantelis, have you tried the latest release? Regards!

content: I have been searching for an app like this for so long. Great app! I did not rate it as 5 stars because I would love to rename the server names.
replyContent: Hi Chady, have you tried the latest release? Regards! EDIT: Thanks for updating your review. What did it miss for 5-stars?

content: Very convenient app, now it even has a modern app icon üòÅ
replyContent: Hi Steve, the icon was already updated in the latest releases. Regards!

content: Great app. However I wished we had our tags as well and not just categories. Another thing is that the total upload/download numbers on the top of the app are reversed on the individual torrents. Color coding these numbers or at least the upload/download symbols will greatly increase readability. And a true dark mode (AMOLED black) will help as well. Even though this is the pro version, would donate more if there was an option.
replyContent: HI A1, that will address in a future release. Best regards!

content: Great app, exactly what I needed. Got tired of using the web ui on mobile. Is there a way or can we get a feature to allow defaulting a folder to where to add torrent files from? It always starts at root level and I have to dig through folders, would be nice to be able to set a default folder to open up.
replyContent: Hi Preshoth, that was added in the last release. Regards!

content: Used the free version for years, now this one. It works generally well, but recently it lost the option to place torents into categories/subfolders. Used to work good until few months ago, now there are no longer menu items for that. Any hope to get that capability back? I see it understands categories, as we can filter by category, but no longer to select one for a new torrent.
replyContent: Hi Nenad. You have to enable categories in Settings. Regards!

content: It's been a while since I've needed it, it works flawlessly!
replyContent: Hi, version 4.7.0 supports 4.2.x (4.1.x are supported as well). Regards! UPDATE: Wait for the update notification from Google Play. Regards!  UPDATE: You should be have the notification already!

content: Does it follow saved path from the server configuration? Or it default as / ? Else is working. Update: great, Thank you Luis.
replyContent: Hi Ariff, it you don't set a save path it will use the default values set on you qBittorrent server. Best Regards!

content: Been using the app for about a year. Just upgraded to the paid version. It does pretty much everything I would want it to do, and does it well. It isn't pretty, though, and it isn't particularly easy to use. For example, I agree with the other person that commented that recent categories should be a radio button or something instead of having to type out the name. It's just kind of awkward. The pause/play icons look out of place and taps on the list should be able to perform more actions.
replyContent: Hi Joe, thanks for your detailed report. I'm aware of all that. For example, there's room for UI improvements and the UX as well (like the category radio button). About the pause/play button if you  have a screenshot it would help. By the way, you can check all the issues of the project at https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/issues

content: Works fine but I have two issues: 1. Can the category be set for existing torrents? 2. When deleting a torrent there is no option to also delete the files from your hard drive, it just removes the torrent from the list.
replyContent: HI Stefan, for deleting the torrent and files you can use the "x" icon (delete data) which deletes the torrent and its files. About setting category or exiting torrents, I have to implement that feature. By the way, you can check all the issues of the project at https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/issues. Regards!

content: Have been having issues with this app since I started saving to a location with a space in the name. For example, I keep trying to save to T:\folder name\ and the app keeps putting a + between folder and name thus creating a new folder every time I add a torrent to that location. Any ideas? I have tried enclosing "folder name" and the entire path in quotations but no luck. Other than that, I have been using the application for years and it's awesome! Keep up the good work. Fixed now somehow?
replyContent: William thanks for reorting it. I'll check it out. In the mean time I created this issue at the project page https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/issues/221. UPDATE: Release 4.8.4 fixes this issue. Regards!

content: Really nice app, does everything I need
replyContent: Hi Martijn, delete files on torrent deletion is available by choosing the X (just beside the trash bin icon). When selecting that option you will be prompted for confirmation. Regards!

content: Just installed and it seems to be working fine - for my needs. Save/category dialog could be a bit more convenient (pre-populate with recent or default values, dropdown lists) but I am quite happy as it is. Update: I know; but a "proper" drop down list without the need to type characters would be more convenient (or even radio buttons)... also looking forward to RSS implementation. Thanks anyway :)
replyContent: Hi Michael, in glad it works for you. Save path and Category dialog is populated using recent values, but you need to write some characters first.

content: Excellent app, well worth the money. 2 things missing for 5 stars: Set global UL/DL limit (there seems to be per-torrent setting) The status bar at the top (current speed, etc) breaks weirdly on my S9+ - I can send a screenshot if needed
replyContent:
Hi Igor, thanks for your comments and your review. I'm aware of the bar top break. I will fix it in a future release. Regards
! UPDATE: I just created this issue for following this https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/issues/228

content: it's not working
replyContent: Could you please be a little more specific about what is not working? Best regards!

content: Host not found error. Web UI is ok and working fine from PC outside lan. Edit : fixed Must add ppa:qbittorrent-team/qbittorrent-stable to your system in order to download the latest version of qbittorrent. After this the app works just fine.
replyContent: Themis, I'm glad you found the issue. Can you share the fix for other users? UPDATE: Awesome!, that way you'll have the latest version from that repo!!

content: Having used it for a while I just bought the pro version. I often had trouble connecting with the free version and the last time it was simply a wrong password. Please add a show password option.
replyContent: Hi Technomad Damole, thanks for your comments and for buying the app. I created an issue here https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/issues/224 to address your suggestion in a future release. Regards!

content: This app makes my life so easy controlling qBittorrent client on my computer. This app is a must-have for those who use qBittorrent!
replyContent: Hi Gu√∞j√≥n, thanks for your 5-stars review and your comments. I'm glad you like the app. Regards!

content: Just bought this app and got it working in and outside home network with some research. Like it so far. Two additions I would like to see are 1. User authentication for the app itself...or am I just not seeing it? 2. Black interface mode (current dark mode is gray not really black). I'd be happy with simply straight black background and white for font. Nice app.

About 2) I added a ticket for this here https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/issues/138, the idea is to address it in future releases.

content: Can not get to work.  Run an Ethernet cable into my laptop.  Have no idea how to figure out how to get the app to connect to the program.  Any help would be appreciated.  Also might be a dumb question but will this only work when I'm in range of the router/modem?  Booted up fine at home this morning finally when I changed a few things around.  I leave the house and it won't work at all.  Also, what username/password is it looking for?
replyContent: Hi chistopher, just set your qBitorrent's account info in Settings and enjoy controlling your torrent remotely. You can also check  the online documentation here http://git.io/pQB5 ? Regards!

content: I love this controller. I have now upgraded to the paid version and it no longer connects even when using the same settings as the ad version.
replyContent: Hi Brady, double check the user account, password, protocol, port, etc. If you are still having problem to connect, delete the app data and set it again. Regards

content: Has everything that the client does. I love this coming from the cancer that is uTorrent remote. Keep up the great work! A more material dark them would be nice, less complete back and more dark grey.
replyContent: Hi Tom, thanks for your comments and rating. I added your suggestion to the project issue tracker https://git.io/v9uBk. Best regards!

content: Need to be uninstall/reinstall every 2 weeks, lame, don't buy, stick to the free, it the same bad piece of code
replyContent: Hi Thomas. Why do you need to reinstall it? What's the issue?  Did you report it? You can use the free version if it works for you or help future developments by buying the Pro version. Regards.

content: Thanks for the response.
replyContent: Hi J R Mtz,  as far I know there is no way to do that in the RSS. Thanks for your rating. Best regards!

content: and awesome developer.  Really useful and always improving.
replyContent: Hi Dennis, thanks for your comments and rating. The idea is to have the best qBittorrent remote ever. Best regards!

content: Unfortunately the magnet links are still not passing... much like the version before last. I am using 4.4.8. Not having issue with dialog.  4.4.6 was the last working version.
replyContent: Hi Eric, new release 4.5.0 should fix the issue. Regards!

content: This has to be the best qt app in the market! Save your time, save your money just buy this app, and enjoy!
replyContent: Hi Bryan, thanks for your comments and rating the app. Enjoy the app. Regards!

content: Lets me see everything on my pc. Only problem I have is that the options menu always tells me getting options and then times out.
replyContent: Hi Josh. Thanks for your comments and rating. Try increasing the connection and data timeout values in Settings - Advanced options. Regards,

content: Other clients don't tend to support qbittorrent to the point some won't have label support. This app works well and is simple to set up. I also like that there's a dark theme. Only thing stopping this from being a 5 star review is a lack of notification settings, e.g. Notification on torrent added, completed, ratio limit hit/pause.
replyContent: Thanks for your comments and rating. You are right, this app focuses on qBittorrent features that other apps don't cover or don't care at all. I created a ticket with your ideas to included in future releases. https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/issues/115. Regards!

content: Tried it for a day and deleted my other torrent application straight after. Web ui way better. Happily paid for this.
replyContent: Hi Karis. Thanks for your comments, rating and suggestions. The idea is to have a great and functional app for all. Best regards!. EDIT: Thanks for your support!

content: Everytime i click a magnet in my RSS feed it constantly opens up a never ending loop of chrome tabs. The only way to stop it is to clear chrome data. Other than that, flawless
replyContent: Hi Reap, thanks for reporting the issue. Can you send me an email with some of those RSS your are opening up? Best regards!

content: Very handy app,  but it needs to help you troubleshoot networking issues. Right now,  if it cannot connect to your torrent client it just silently ignores this without giving you any error message. And it is quite flimsy. Even when it has been working fine for a while,  suddenly it can't connect. A few tries later,  it works again, until it doesn't. No indication to why or when it happens.
replyContent: Hi Tonny, if you are having networking issues you can try increasing the timeout values in Settings. Regarding this I created a request in qBController project https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/issues/108 to be included in further releases. Regards!

content: Truly the best companion app to the best torrent client. This app makes it so easy to add torrents to my server while I'm at hone or away from home. I wish you guys would add a button to open torrents from a location while still keeping the option of entering URL. Integration doesn't work well on my phone for some reason that button would help.
replyContent: Hi TekTonik. I think it can be possible. I create a ticket to keep track of this request https://github.com/lgallard/qBittorrent-Controller/issues/100. Meanwhile,  you can install an File Manager like ES File Manager or such and browse to your torrent files and open them. Regards!

content: Love this app.. got pro version for extra features and to support the dev... Well done!!
replyContent: Thanks Paul for your support, comments and rating. Enjoy the pro version!

content: Thought I'd update my rating, guess what? Still the best app on here alongside clementine remote & a few others! I 100% control my music-pc, download & play music. The haters are noobs that dont know how to make things work lol!
replyContent: Hi Karl, Thanks for your rating and comments. I hope you like the Pro version. EDIT: Thanks one more time for your support. Best regards!

content: Better yet a very responsive dev. Had an issue. Emailed developer. Responded within two hours. New version with fix released in under 24 hours. A great example of how to support an app.
replyContent: Hi Jeff, I really appreciate your comments and rating. I hope the app helps you to manage your torrent collection. Best regards!

content: Some features are not working on Android 6.0.1, Im not able to set download speed limit thru this app. Also, sequential download option is nowhere to be found.
replyContent: Hi Carlos, the sequential download option is available from the torrent details menu or when selecting several torrents at the same time. But keep in mind you qBittorrent server must be 3.2.1 or higher. EDIT: Fixed the speed limit issue in the latest release. Best regards!

content: Note: webui is active, and I know the server IP and port. I'd really like to give a positive review of this app the interface is really slick. Unfortunately I cannot get it to connect to my server on an OS X 10.6 host. The port is open and I have put in the host name and/or IP but I just can't get it to work. Maybe with a little help to get it to work I'll be totally willing to upgrade the rating as I want to I like this app
replyContent: Hi Kristoffer, If you are on Android 6, check you have granted the Storage permission. Go to Settings > Apps > qBController and then got to Permission to grant it. Please keep me posted. Regards!

content: It's a great app, and is exactly what I'm looking for. Minor problem I have is that it doesn't read labels already set on the client. Also, when setting labels it'd be nice to choose from a drop down box of previously added labels. Just like how the web ui works.
replyContent: Hi Shaawin, thanks for your rating and comments. The complete list of labels are got when listing all torrent, if you list just "Downloading" you will get a partial label list. That's why I didn't implement the drop down box, because there is no guarantee all labels will be listed. I will request a "Gell All Labels" function in qBittorrent project

content: I am revising my review below and updating to five stars. Dev fixed the bug and now its great! Works great, got it set up with web UI. Problem I have is it states "network error" and "authentication error" when it loads, but I refresh and it connects. Minor, but annoying.
replyContent: Hi Brian. This issue was fixed in the latest release. Regards! EDIT: Thanks for your comments and rating. Best regards!

content: Brought up a minor issue with the app and the developer talked with me about it and changed it within hours.
replyContent: Hi Rob, Thanks for reporting the issue. Best regards!

content: Great app but seems to hijack RSS links alot.
replyContent: Hi Zack, thanks for your comments and rating. Why do you say it seems to hijack RSS links a lot? Best regards!

content: This app is worth gold since Im not home that much I can still track what's going on.
replyContent: Hi wes, thanks for your comments and rating. I'm glad you like qBittorrent and the Android app. Best regards!

content: it worked, then it broke, then within 3 days it worked again - great support. probably the best of the bunch, it works very well. thanks to the developer!
replyContent: Hi Lawrence. It affected devices with Android version 4.4.x and below. It was fixed in app version 4.3.1. EDIT: Thanks for your comments and rating. Regards!

replyContent: Hi James, It affected devices with Android version 4.4.x and below. It was fixed in app version 4.3.1. EDIT: Thanks for your comments and rating. Regards!

content: Well built app. Just a couple of things..   1. Need to be able to label 2. Need to be able to sort by 'date added'
replyContent: Hi Mark, EDIT: Sort by "Added on" and "Completed on" are available in the latest release for qBittorrent 3.3.4+. EDIT2: Labels are available in the latest release. Regards!

content: I have tried them all for multiple torrent clients and this one is by far the best. The most features plus a developer who constantly updates and is available for support or suggestions. Highly recommended.
replyContent: Hi Chuck. Thanks for your comments, rating and suggestions. The idea is to have a great and functional app for all. Best regards!

content: This is better than any other on app store beats having to use utorrent with all the dam adds :)
replyContent: Hi Brian thanks for your comments and rating. I'm glad you like qBittorrent and the Android app. Best regards!

content: Great remote but needs to allow me to choose my download path, would make life easy for us plex fans out there.
replyContent: Hi Dave. This option is available in the latest release. Go to Settings - Appearance - Save path and Label dialog. Enjoy!

content: Good option is to add local and remote server options, so it switch to local profile when at home wireless and switch to remote profile when not at home. I know we can make profiles and switch between but then we will lose notifications, and should always switch profiles and ... transdrone has the same amazing option.
replyContent: Hi payam, the local network feature is included in the latest version. Go to Settings - Advanced options. Best regards!

content: Clean interface. Good control. I'd like to be able the shutdown options, but u can't have everything in this life :)
replyContent: HI Gorka, thanks for your comments and rating. Why would you like shutdown remotely? You can pause all torrents if you need to "stop" qBittorrent server. Regards!

content: I've been very happy with qbit and now this makes for a perfect combo ! I can access qbit via noip wherever I am . Great stuff :)
replyContent: Hi Stephen, thanks for sharing your experience with qBittorrent Controller Pro, and for rating the app. I hope it helps you to manage your torrents remotely. Best regards!

content: Unable to connect at all with the latest update. Web ui us working so I know it's an app isse. Please fix....
replyContent: Hi Dillon, EDIT: Have you tried the latest releases? You can generate a report from Help > Generate report or you can share what message you got when trying to connect? Best regards!

content: Working perfect thank you!
replyContent: Hi Christopher, version 4.1.4 fixes the authentication issue with qBittorrent version 3.2.1. Note: After the update, if you still have the authentication error you might need to close and start the app. EDIT: Thanks for your comments and the rating. Best regards!

content: This app (along with the server) gives the ability to completely control and tweak pretty much any aspect of your torrents remotely. LOVE IT
replyContent: Hi OPeCKiE, I'm glad you like qBittorrent (server and Android app). The lack of a good remote for qB was my main motivation for developing the app. Thanks for your comments and rating.

content: Material design update is great! Am I missing something or have you removed the ability to delete a torrent and it's files?
replyContent: Hi Trevor, thanks for comments about the Material design update. Delete torrent and its data is still available. Just touch the X icon beside the trash bin icon in the torrent details view. Let me know if you can't see the X icon. Best regards!

content: So sexy now its material design
replyContent: Thanks Alan for your comments and rating. I'm glad you like the Materia Design adaptation. Best regards!

content: I've tried everything I can think of but can't connect remotely.
replyContent: Hi John, the latest version fixes all connection issues. Best regards! EDIT: Have you tried the latest releases? Regards!

content: UPDATE 05/15/2015 Got feedback from the developer the day after my review, and an update was published the day after that. Working fine now and does exactly what ti's always done. Upgrading from 3 to 5 stars   I recently updated my computer to qBittorrent 3.2 and the Android app no longer works. Despite changing the app setting to recognize v3.2, uninstalling and reinstalling and trying 2 different android devices with 2 different computers, I couldn't connect to v3.2  of the desktop software.  Downgrading to 3.1.12 immediately resolved my issues. Would have given 5 stars before the last desktop update but leaving at 3 until this issue is resolved.
replyContent: Hi Rock,  version 3.94 fixed the authentication issue with qBittorrent version 3.2.0. Note: You might need to restart your qBittorrent server (webui) because your device might be blocked due to the failed attempts.  Please keep me posted. Regards!  EDIT: Thanks for your comments and the rating. Best regards!

content: This app is the main reason for me swapping from uTorrent, works flawlessly for me, once set up it hasn't missed a beat and let's me control my torrents at home from anywhere.
replyContent: Hi Sam, thanks for your comments and rating. I'm glad you like qBittorrent and to know it works for yout flawlessly. Best regards!

content: Ive been working on getting this app connected to my Qbittorrent client for awhile now, have everything set up right and can connect in browers, just not through the app. if i could get this working, it would totally be a 5 start app
replyContent: Hi Tammer, you can check how to set your connection here http://git.io/pQB5. Please keep me posted. Best regards! EDIT: Have you tried the latest releases? Regards!

content: Is it possible to add an option to sort by date (date added/created on; and completion date)?
replyContent: Hi Jeff, thanks for your rating. Edit: Sort by Added on and Completion on is available in the latest version. Keep in mind it works with qBittorrent server version 3.3.4. Best regards.

content: Works perfectly easy setup had it running in under 2 mins great work  No problems running under lollipop either
replyContent: Azeez thanks for reporting it works on Lollipop, also thanks for your comments and rating. I hope it helps you to manage your torrents. Best regards!

content: Great app. Keep up the good work
replyContent: Michael thanks for your comments and rating. I hope it helps you to manage your torrents. Best regards!

content: Works fine on home network but will not connect over 3/4g even though I have correctly configured all required settings in the Windows UI. Am I doing something wrong? I need to be able to send a torrent file whilst out and about..
replyContent:
Hi Mike,

It works over 3G/4G, I send torrents all the time on the go...but you have to use your public IP address for accessing qBittorrent Web UI. Did you try reaching the Web UI over 3G/4G. Please keep me informed to help you. EDIT: Hi Mike, Have you tried the latest releases? Regards!

content: Option to sort torrents added, as well as the fifth star.
replyContent: Hi Ivan, sorting by Name, Priority, ETA, Progress, Ratio, Upload and Download speed is available in the latest release. EDIT: Sort by "Added on" and "Completed on" are available in the latest release for qBittorrent 3.3.4+. Best regards!

content: Work like a charm
replyContent: Hi Dejan thanks for your comments and rating. I hope it helps you to manage your torrents. Best regards!
